text.body:
Dear Sir
i am perfectly aware that i ought to have written sooner to let you know how we got on at Huddersfield, but illness is my excuse and business Father[']s, i am not quite certain whether it was grief at leaving Sheffield, or the sight of Huddersfield, the most horrible town i ever put my foot in, that caused my illness but i was taken very ill on Saturday night, but thank the Father Son and Holy Ghost i am recovering,
Father delivered six lectures in Huddersfield, commencing on Thursday, with three on Sunday, to an audience something like Angel's visits "few and far between", in a room, not [[2]] a room but a hen roost, or pig stye [sic] or hardly good enough for either, He left on Monday afternoon and arrived here about eight in the evening, since which time i have only left my bed when nature or God the Father, the physical power forced me,
Father is gone to Bolton to Lecture this evening, and perhaps to-morrow, he is not over well.
If any thing particular should [happen/arise?] in the course of a few days, a letter will find us at Mr Heywood[']s 60 Oldham Street,
the Owenistites are creating a great sensation here, there are Lectures and sermons preached by the parsons every day, on the danger of the "Infidelity preached at Mr Bywater's Rooms"
I must be quick the senna is nearly ready and i shan't be able to write after that. [[3]] i hear for certain that Mr. C. Clements is discharged from the Champion, Give our compliments to all respectable Infidels, and say that [father] is grieved that he could not convert them, to the true Faith, Say something very kind for me to all your family, I'm afraid i shall never see them again, as i expect, in the present state of things, to be in Abraham's bosom before next spring. i remain | rather worse than i was a week ago thomas paine carlile Assitan[t] Missionary in the cause of Our Lord and Saviour | Jesus Christ
My kindest love to Mrs B.....
